qas.question: When was the Zinoviev letter published?
After how long did the government collapse?
What was rebuilt after only nine months?

plausible_answers.text: Select Committee inquiry into the Campbell Case

qas.question: What did the Conservatives vote for?
What letter was published just before the 1920 election?
Who was talking about a Communist revolution in America?
What had a big impact on the Labour vote?

context: The <b2_0>government<b2_0/> collapsed after only <a1_0>nine months<a1_0/> when the Liberals voted for a <b3_0>Select Committee inquiry into the Campbell Case<b3_0/>, a vote which MacDonald had declared to be a vote of confidence. The ensuing <a0_0>1924<a0_0/> general election saw the publication, four days before polling day, of the <b4_0>Zinoviev<b4_0/> letter, in which <b5_0>Moscow<b5_0/> talked about a Communist revolution in Britain. The <b6_0>letter<b6_0/> had little impact on the Labour vote—which held up. It was the collapse of the Liberal party that led to the Conservative landslide. The Conservatives were returned to power although Labour increased its vote from 30.7% to a third of the popular vote, most Conservative gains being at the expense of the Liberals. However many Labourites for years blamed their defeat on foul play (the Zinoviev Letter), thereby according to A. J. P. Taylor misunderstanding the political forces at work and delaying needed reforms in the party.
